<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs=""
>
[Subtle Shank](/Feats.aspx?ID=2208) <actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Agents of Edgewatch</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Flourish" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=73" />
<trait label="Rogue" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=139" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #159: All or Nothing](/Sources.aspx?ID=48) pg. 75</row>

**Prerequisites**
[Quick Draw](/Feats.aspx?ID=498)

**Access**
Help either the Washboard Dogs or the Diobel Sweepers destroy their rival.

**Requirements**
You have a melee weapon of light bulk [Concealed](/Actions.aspx?ID=61) on your person via the [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) skill, and the target isn't aware of it.

</column>

---

You draw a concealed weapon, attack with it, and then hide it away again in one smooth motion. Interact to draw the weapon, Strike with that weapon, and then Conceal it with a Stealth check. The target is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) for this attack.

<title level="2">Gang Feats</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #159: All or Nothing](/Sources.aspx?ID=48) pg. 75</row>

Street gangs in Absalom recruit amateur pickpockets, ruffians, and vandals who show promise in their specialties and operate well in tight groups.

 Rogue agents can gain access to some of the following rogue feats by successfully helping Maurrisa Jonne or Bloody Berleth eliminate their rival (see Chapter 1). Some of these feats, however, can be gained only by helping a particular side in the gang conflict.

**Related Feats**: [Ambushing Knockdown](/Feats.aspx?ID=2207), [Coordinated Distraction](/Feats.aspx?ID=2210), [Deny Support](/Feats.aspx?ID=2209), [Slice and Swipe](/Feats.aspx?ID=2206)
